news.title: Austrians hold vigil to mourn 10 victims of school shooting
news.summary: Thousands gather in near silence in Graz after the deadliest gun attack in the country's recent history.

news.title: Fireworks and bottles thrown at police as Ballymena violence flares for second night
news.summary: Police say a number of homes and businesses were attacked as violence erupted again on Tuesday night.

news.title: Twix advert banned for encouraging unsafe driving
news.summary: The video advert shows a car chase that ends with two caramel-coloured cars on top of each other.

news.title: Ban on 'no ball games' signs suggested to get kids off screens
news.summary: Experts say outdoor play in England has declined by 50% and are calling for urgent change.

news.title: Scrap Chagos Islands deal and agree new one, UN panel urges UK
news.summary: A UN human rights panel says the deal "fails to guarantee" the rights of Chagossians.

news.title: People on £10,000 to £96,000 tell us what they want the UK to spend money on
news.summary: As the government outlines its spending plans, people with a range of incomes tell us where they think the money should go.

news.title: Spending Review to shape Scotland's priorities for years to come
news.summary: Announcements from Chancellor Rachel Reeves later will have a significant effect on public spending in Scotland.

news.title: Gangster tells BBC why India's biggest hip-hop star was murdered
news.summary: Three years after Moose Wala's murder, the BBC investigates how he found himself an enemy of a feared gang.

news.title: The Papers: '£39bn new build' for affordable homes, and 'giant spending spree'
news.summary: Wednesday's newspaper front pages largely focus on the chancellor's Spending Review.

news.title: 'Un-American' or 'necessary'? Voters divided on Trump's LA protest crackdown
news.summary: Six Americans tell the BBC that there's clearly a problem in Los Angeles - they just don't agree with who's at fault.
